Articles.Content:
[@FreeThinker](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/117389-freethinker/)

I'm replacing Firespitter with this for one of my mods,  Would it be ok for me to bundle the current version?  I \_think\_ I only need the dll, but was planning on including what <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> installs as the core parts.

Let me know, thanks

> 
> 
> 6 hours ago, linuxgurugamer said:
> 
> 
> [@FreeThinker](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/117389-freethinker/)
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I'm replacing Firespitter with this for one of my mods,  Would it be ok for me to bundle the current version?  I \_think\_ I only need the dll, but was planning on including what <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> installs as the core parts.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Let me know, thanks
> 

Yes of course, everyone is doing it already. Mod designers are indeed advised to use the <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> IFS core, which will leave out IFS premium tanks, they also serve as an example as how to use them.

**Edited <time datetime="2018-05-10T19:29:48Z" title="05/10/2018 07:29  PM" data-short="6 yr">May 10, 2018</time> by FreeThinker**

> 
> 
> 5 minutes ago, FreeThinker said:
> 
> 
> Yes of course, everyone is doing it already. Mod designers﻿ are indeed advised to use the <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> IFS core, which will leave out IFS premium tanks, they also serve as an example as how to use them.
> 

Thanks.

Next release will introduce the ability to scale the baseMass separately from the divider mass. THis allows you improve mass ratio for light propellant in a balanced way

Example

![9q5CUXp.png](https://i.imgur.com/9q5CUXp.png)

and scaled up

![nGWbrLe.png](https://i.imgur.com/nGWbrLe.png)

Notice the improvement in mass ratio which will go from 8.9 to 9.8.

This will make single big tank have better mass ratios than many small tanks

**Edited <time datetime="2018-05-10T19:34:47Z" title="05/10/2018 07:34  PM" data-short="6 yr">May 10, 2018</time> by FreeThinker**

## 
Version 3.2.0 <small>for Kerbal Space Program 1.4.3 can be downloaded from </small>[here](https://kerbal.curseforge.com/projects/interstellar-fuel-switch/files/2560647/download)

<small>Released on 2018-05-10</small>

- Added property baseMassExponent, which replaces massExponent and allows scaling of base and tank mass
- Added property tweakscaleMassExponent \*default 3) which defines tweakscale mass exponent
- Added improved mass scaling to IFS CC, CT, IST, SPG and RFC tanks
- Fixed issue where <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr> engineer report vessel mass was not updated properly after changing scale
Haven't fixed the ~140 <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> errors.

[@FreeThinker](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/117389-freethinker/) ~~I got 3 <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> errors, look like syntax errors~~:

Spoiler

[WRN 02:58:40.491] [ModuleManager] Cannot find key tankSwitchNames in MODULE
    [ERR 02:58:40.491] [ModuleManager] Error - Cannot parse variable search when inserting new key tankSwitchNames = #$@PART[CDT2001]/MODULE[InterstellarMeshSwitch]/tankSwitchNames$
    
    [LOG 02:58:40.491] [ModuleManager] Applying update InterstellarFuelSwitch/Patches/IFSCDTmodular/@PART[CDT201?]:HAS[@RESOURCE[LiterVolume]] to InterstellarFuelSwitch/Parts/TankRevamp/CDT2012/PART
    [WRN 02:58:40.491] [ModuleManager] Cannot find key tankSwitchNames in MODULE
    [ERR 02:58:40.491] [ModuleManager] Error - Cannot parse variable search when inserting new key tankSwitchNames = #$@PART[CDT2001]/MODULE[InterstellarMeshSwitch]/tankSwitchNames$
    
    [LOG 02:58:40.491] [ModuleManager] Applying update InterstellarFuelSwitch/Patches/IFSCDTmodular/@PART[CDT201?]:HAS[@RESOURCE[LiterVolume]] to InterstellarFuelSwitch/Parts/TankRevamp/CDT2013/PART
    [WRN 02:58:40.491] [ModuleManager] Cannot find key tankSwitchNames in MODULE
    [ERR 02:58:40.491] [ModuleManager] Error - Cannot parse variable search when inserting new key tankSwitchNames = #$@PART[CDT2001]/MODULE[InterstellarMeshSwitch]/tankSwitchNames$

because "Cannot parse variable search when inserting new key"

Edit:

but wait, perhaps I did something I shouldn't do in Patch Manager ...

Yeah, I did. I guess that patch was meant for MFT/RF. Issue gone.

Right, I forgot to remove CDT4Setups and CDT12Setups, they are no longer used and will probably break stuff when activated. Will fix that for next update.

Did you delete IFS before upgrading to the latest version?

## 
Version 3.3 <small>for Kerbal Space Program 1.4.3 can be downloaded from </small>[here](https://kerbal.curseforge.com/projects/interstellar-fuel-switch/files/2561317/download)

<small>Released on 2018-05-13</small>

- Added property orderByIndexNames which sort all tanks alphabetically on indexName
- Added property indexNames to InterstellarMeshSwitch which can be used for sorting
- Added property defaultTank to InterstellarFuelSwitch which defines the initial tank configuration
- Balance: improved mass ratio s of larger IFS Cryo Tanks compared to smaller tanks
- Balance: reduce power cost of larger IFS Cryo Tanks compared to smaller tanks
- Balance: slightly improved mass ratios for scaled up tanks
- Fixed alphabetic sorting of tank configuration for IFS Cryo tanks
- Fixed interface switcher issue for IFS Cryo and Gas Tanks

> 
> 
> On 5/11/2018 at 2:25 PM, Eleusis La Arwall said:
> 
> 
> Right, I forgot to remove CDT4Setups and CDT12Setups, they are no longer used and will probably break stuff when activated. Will fix that for next update.
> 

In 3.3 they're still in.

## 
Version 3.4 <small>for Kerbal Space Program 1.4.3 can be downloaded from </small>[here](https://kerbal.curseforge.com/projects/interstellar-fuel-switch/files/2562216/download)

<small>Released on 2018-05-15</small>

- Updated MiniAVC to 1.0.3.2
- Removed content from old <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> and PM configs by EleusisLaArwall
- Fixed excessive error log spamming of IFS partmodules

## 
Version 3.5 <small>for Kerbal Space Program 1.4.3 can be downloaded from </small>[here](https://kerbal.curseforge.com/projects/interstellar-fuel-switch/files/2564471/download)

<small>Released on 2018-05-22</small>

- Added support for 4 managed resources
- Fixed negative tank cost for tanks with more than 2 resources

I'm having issues with getting <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> to install the latest update for Intersteller Fuel Switch Core.  It claims it is already installed...

> 
> 
> 4 hours ago, Duke Leto said:
> 
> 
> I'm having issues with getting <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> to install the latest update for Intersteller Fuel Switch Core.  It claims it is already installed...
> 

I think you should report this issue in the <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> forum

[@Duke Leto](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/142852-duke-leto/)    Just delete the one installed in your Gamedata folder and then install new one from <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>.

I did.

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, glibbo said:
> 
> 
> [@Duke Leto](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/142852-duke-leto/)    Just delete the one installed in your Gamedata folder and then install new one from <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I did.
> 

Huh, well that worked.  OK, problem solved, drinks all around!

### 
Interstellar Fuel Switch Pack 3.6.0 can be downloaded from [here](https://kerbal.curseforge.com/projects/interstellar-fuel-switch/files/2565360/download)

#### 
Changelog

\*  Fixed initialization error in InterstellarMeshSwitch after cloning part in <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>

Hello,

I install/uninstall pretty much all my mods with <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>. I'm running KSP version 1.4.3.

I'm having some weird issues with part sorting by mass in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>/<abbr title="SpacePlane Hangar">SPH</abbr> with parts from mods that have fuel/supplies included in the part. 

Parts with fuel included in the part, like the dragon command pod from kerbalized spacex, are sorting on the parts list via their dry weight even though when I hover my mouse over the part it lists the wet weight....so it's like some parts aern't sorting properly.

I'm also getting a lot of weird decimal place weights instead of normal rounded weights.

I'm having a hell of a time figuring out WTH is going on. It's obviously not game breaking, but it's driving me nuts.

I have no idea what is causing it to happen, but as it happens with several different mods and not stock parts I am figuring it is due to a mod that affects other mods like this one or maybe module manager itself.

I'm a pretty big noob so I don't really know how to code, or program, or even edit module manager files....

I didn't know if you or anyone else in the thread had any ideas though.

I wrote in the technical help forum yesterday, but since I didn't include logs and stuff, I figure no one is going to answer my question....

Will a log file help me get help?:

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/hdwj6aluwl4lik1/KSP Errors.rar?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/hdwj6aluwl4lik1/KSP%20Errors.rar?dl=0)

**Edited <time datetime="2018-07-03T19:50:44Z" title="07/03/2018 07:50  PM" data-short="6 yr">July 3, 2018</time> by JoE Smash**
  
output log now included

So what mods use this by default, and does it work on stock tanks? KW Rocketry Rebalanced?

I have no idea what broke my game last time, but it persisted until I uninstalled all mods and clean installed the game. I guess my save is now corrupted permanently....

Any idea what would change the mass of all fuel/tanks/command pods in my game to some number that made everything weigh weird decimal values? Then nothing sorted by mass properly anymore.....

Does this work for 1.4.4? I tried,and it's fine, but I have a suspicion that the fuel tank is lighter than it should be. i changed the fuel of the mk2 to 1.25 short and the mk2 bicoupler. Maybe thats what happened to [@JoE Smash](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/189611-joe-smash/)?
